chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Greenwald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another conviction.  Mandatory DNA Surcharge imposed.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Term of imprisonment as to Count Nos. 3, 4 and 5

miscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence as to Count Nos. 3, 4 and 5, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of probation as to Count Nos. 2, 6 and 7.
No DNA sample ordered as to Count Nos 2, 6 and 7 as Defendant previously provided the same through another conviction.  Mandatory DNA Surcharge imposed as to each count.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no contact with with any named victims (Adlai Herschberger, Richard Swanke and/or Kenneth Stauffer) and/or the premises of Premier Livestock and Auction located in Withee, Wisconsin.  Defendant is prohibited from selling any livestock whether at auction or in any other capacity.  Defendant is prohibited from selling any farm equipment or anything to do with the agricultural industry without express authority of the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $2000.00 has been applied and disbursed to the victim directly by the Clerk of Circuit Court.  The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any restitution remains outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  The remaining balance of the Restitution is to be repaid in monthly increments of not less than $250.00, payable on the first of each month, one full month removed from initial confinement.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from extended supervision with any outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no contact with with any named victims (Adlai Herschberger, Richard Swanke and/or Kenneth Stauffer) and/or the premises of Premier Livestock and Auction located in Withee, Wisconsin.  Defendant is prohibited from selling any livestock whether at auction or in any other capacity.  Defendant is prohibited from selling any farm equipment or anything to do with the agricultural industry without express authority of the supervising agent.
No DNA sample ordered to Count Nos. 3, 4 and 5 as Defendant previously provided the same through another conviction.  Mandatory DNA Surcharge imposed as to each count.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 3.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 3.

As to Count No 1 (OAR)
Associated with Charge #1

Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lennon states that he was advised this morning that Def no longer wishes to have him be represented by Atty Lennon.  Court will honor Atty Lennon's wishes to withdraw based upon Def's wishes.  Def states that he wishes to proceed to SEH today without the services of Atty Lennon and exercise his right of allocution.  Court advises Def of the risks of proceeding today without counsel.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.  Atty Lennon moves to withdraw and Court will allow.  Court will permit the constitutional right of Def to represent himself and Court confirms granting the withdrawal.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Argument by ADA Anderson as to SEH recommendations.  Statement by Def prior to SEH - Def reads in his written statement.  Court advises Def of right to PSI investigation in light of his statement.  Def will not be requesting a PSI preparation.  The Court:  Reminds Def of Ludwig document signed and filed.  As to Ct 1:  Orders Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  As to Cts 3,4 and 5 2nd Amended INFO:  Concurrent 5 yr term of imprisonment - bifurcated into 2 yr IC/3 yr ES - concurrent to one another.  Conditions of ES:  Rest of $4347.00 - Dept authorized to collect from any wages or funds; Ext Costs of $1839.00; Witness Fees $287.67; Costs in the action be paid - 60 DTP or PP; First day of the 1st month one full month removed from IC - maintain Rest payments of not less than $250 each month;  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru; No contact with the victims and/or Premiere Livestock and Auction in Withee; prohibited from selling any livestock whether at auction or in any other capacity; prevented from selling any farm equipment or anything to do with the agricultural industry without express authority of agent; 67 days TS credit (34 days from bond revoked and 33 days incarcerated on our warrant - maximum allowable TS credit).  As to Cts 2, 6 and 7 - S/W - 2 yrs probation - Consecutive to term of imprisonment in Counts 3, 4 and 5 with identical conditions - adequate supervision for a prolonged period of time with Court Costs and all same conditions.  Appeal Rights Given.  DNA on file.
Witness Fee Certificates-Total witness fees-$287.67
Guilty to Counts 1- 7
Exhibits #1-#10 from December 1, 2017 Jury Trial
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Note from Jury-verdict reached
Sentencing hearing on January 4, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

8:11 am case called. Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the second amended information filed. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt, waives formal reading-Defendant continues Not Guilty to all counts. Stipulation entered on the record as to the charges in Count 2, Count 6, & Count 7. Court questions defendant regarding stipulation and accepts stipulation as entered on the record.  Statement between court and counsel . DA Anderson makes statement regarding 906.09 motion and request the correct number for previous convictions would be 13 instead of the previously entered 12 due to a recent entry of conviction in Green Lake County. Court finds that based on the information provided the correct number of convictions would be 13 and if the defendant elects to testify-the correct number would be 13. If defendant answers the question correctly, the state would be prohibited from questioning the defendant further. Further statement by DA Anderson regarding other acts motion. Attorney Lennon objects to other acts motion by the State. Court reviewed the 904.02 motion and grants the motion as filed by the State. Further housekeeping by DA Anderson. Court discusses minute sheet previously certified by the Clerk of Court's office. Exhibit #1 & Exhibit #2 offered and received. . Stipulation entered as to driving status. Attorney Lennon confirms rejection of plea offer and reconfirms such on record. 8:45 am Jury brought into courtroom and voir dire begins. Entire panel sworn by clerk. 9:23 am Peremptory Strikes begin.  9:31 am Impaneled jurors sworn. Remainder of juror excused from the courtroom. Court admonishes the impaneled jurors regarding communication, cell phones, and research. 9:37 Court recesses. 9:56 am case recalled-same appearances. 10:01 Opening Statement by DA Anderson. 10:12 am Attorney Lennon waives his opening statement at this point. 10:13 am State begins case in Chief. DA Anderson calls Deputy Ryan McElroy, witness sworn, testimony given. No cross by Attorney Lennon. 10:18 am witness excused, DA Anderson calls Karl Guenther, witness sworn by clerk, testimony given. Exhibit #3 offered and received. No cross by Attorney Lennon. 10:29 am witness excused. DA Anderson calls, Richard Swanke, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #4 offered and received. 10:41 am Cross exam by Attorney Lennon. 10:59 Redirect and Recross. Witness excused. DA Anderson calls Adlai Herschberger, wttness sworn, testimony given. Identification of defendant by witness. No cross exam by Attorney Lennon. 11:10 am  DA Anderson calls Ken Stauffer, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #5, Exhibit #6, Exhibit #7 offered and received. No cross exam by Attorney Lennon. 11:20 am DA Anderson calls, Lara Correll, witness sworn, testimony given. Positive identification of defendant. No cross exam by Attorney Lennon. Witness excused. 11:24 am DA Anderson calls Det. Sgt. Jim Leitz, witness sworn, testimony given. No cross exam by Attorney Lennon. 11:32 am DA Anderson calls Susan Barth, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #9 & #10 offered and received. State rests. 11:49 am witness excused. Jury excused from the courtroom. Court questions Attorney Lennon regarding the testimony of the defendant. Court questions defendant regarding right to testify or exercise his right to not testify. 12:03 pm case recalled-same appearances. Court questions defendant regarding his right to testify. Defendant wishes to testify and Court addresses the defendant's waiver of his right to self incrimination and finds it voluntarily, intelligently, and knowingly. Court permits defendant to testify. 12:47 am case recalled-same appearances. Attorney Lennon states he will give his opening statement and then will call the defendant. 12:48 pm jury returned to courtroom. 12:51 pm Opening Statement by Attorney Lennon. Attorney Lennon calls Michael Greenwald, witness sworn, testimony given. 1:03 pm Cross exam by DA Anderson. Testimony given. 1:07 pm witness excused. Defense rests. State does not offer rebuttal testimony. Evidence is closed. 1:08 pm jury excused for instruction conference. Instruction conference held with counsel. 1:30 pm case recalled-same appearances. Instructions corrected. Attorney Lennon makes a statement-defendant wishes to give the closing argument in the case today. Court questions defendant regarding closing argument. Defendant makes statement regarding representation of counsel. Court questions defendant. Court finds the defendant has made a voluntary, intelligent, and knowing waiver to have his attorney give his closing argument. Defendant wishes to proceed with giving a closing argument. Court will draft an instruction to the effect of the defendant giving his own closing argument. 1:40 jury returned to the courtroom. Jury instructions read by the Court to jury. 2:07 pm Closing argument by DA Anderson. 2:20 pm Closing argument by defendant. 2:34 pm Court continues jury instruction-proposed verdicts read. Bailiff's Sworn, Jury charged to begin deliberations. 2:41 pm Court recesses for deliberations. 3:22 pm Court recalls case-same appearances. Jury returned to the courtroom. Court reads verdicts-Count 1-Guilty, Count 2-Guilty, Count 3-Guilty, Count 4-Guilty, Count 5-Guilty, Count 6-Guilty, and Count 7-Guilty. Court polls each juror as to the reading of the verdict-verdict is of each juror and the jury as a whole. 3:29 pm Court excuses jury and thanks them for their service. Jury excused. 3:30pm-DA Anderson requests JOC . Court enters JOC based up on the jury verdicts. Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to custody. DA Anderson does not request a PSI be completed. Court does not orders a PSI and schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Jury trial on December 1, 2017 at 08:00 am.

11:23 am cases called-15CF73, 15CM93, & 17CF84. Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motions filed by counsel and questions how the matters will proceed. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding joinder discussion and declaration to reject the plea offer from the State. Further statement by Attorney Lennon regarding trial. Court accepts the rejection of plea offer of the defendant, questions defendant regarding rejection and orders the offer of settlement to be sealed.  Court addresses joinder motion on 17CF84. Statement by Attorney Lennon-does not have any grounds to object to the joinder motion. Court grants motion for joinder of 17CF84 & 15CM93 into 15CF73. Further statement regarding joinder issue and order. ADA Anderson files an Amended Information. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading and enters pleas of Not Guilty to all counts. Court questions parties regarding balance of motions-906.09 motion requested to be addressed by ADA Anderson. Court addresses motions in limine and will grant all. Court reviews 906.09 motion- finds 12 prior convictions and admits evidence of said convictions. Court discusses prior convictions with defendant and if he were to elect to testify what the correct answer would be and if answered correctly the State would be precluded from asking any further questions regarding prior convictions. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding additional conviction and another motion being filed to include the newest conviction. Court and counsel discuss day of trial. 23 in box, 5 strikes each-1 provisional juror. ADA Anderson makes statement regarding witness list of defense. Attorney Lennon states he will not be filing a witness list.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on October 6, 2017 at 11:15 am.

9:02 am cases called-17CF73, 15CM93, & 17CF84. Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding non-appearance of defendant. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding status of defendant-contact with defendant regarding offer being made and conversation with defendant regarding appearance today. Attorney Lennon requests leave to contact defendant regarding status. Court respectfully declines to adjourn matter and issues warrant, Continental US on all matters.
9:29 am cases recalled-Attorney Lennon appears by phone, defendant appears in court & ADA Anderson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdraws warrant previously authorized and questions counsel regarding proceeding. Court addresses defendant and non-appearance. Court questions defendant. Court questions Attorney Lennon. Attorney Lennon makes statement to court and questions defendant-Defendant does not accept the offer of the State. Court reschedules matters for final PTC.
